minecolonies.config.pathfinding.comment: Todas as Configurações Relacionadas ao Pathfinding
minecolonies.config.requestSystem.commen: Todas as configurações relacionadas ao sistema de requerimentos
minecolonies.config.commands.comment: All configurations related to the MineColonies commands
minecolonies.config.diseasemodifier.comm: How common diseases are. 1 = Very common, 100 = extremely rare.
minecolonies.config.diseases.comment: Todas as Doenças que os Cidadãos Podem ter. O Nome, Quanto Comum é, e Todos os Ingredientes para Curar.
minecolonies.config.generatesupplyloot.c: Whether to generate supply ship/camps in chests occasionally.
minecolonies.config.forceloadcolony.comm: If part of the colony is loaded by an owner/officer, the entire colony should be kept loaded.
minecolonies.config.badvisitorchance.com: Chance to get an evil tavern visitor which can run off with the resources, in % [Default: 2]
minecolonies.config.listofplantables.com: The items and item-tags that the Florist can plant.
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.rest: Area %s is too large. Maximum restricted area for the Forester is %s blocks.
Forester restricted area set. Size is %s blocks. Max size is %s blocks.
minecolonies.config.names.comment: Todas as configurações relacionadas aos nomes dos cidadãos
minecolonies.config.usemiddleinitial.com: Should citizens have a middle initial?
minecolonies.config.malefirstnames.comme: Nomes masculinos a serem dados aos colonizadores
minecolonies.config.femalefirstnames.com: Nomes femininos a serem dados as colonizadoras
minecolonies.config.lastnames.comment: Sobrenomes a serem dados aos colonos
minecolonies.config.builderplaceconstruc: Should construction tape be placed around in-construction builds?
minecolonies.config.allowinfinitesupplyc: Should players be able to place an infinite amount of supply camps/ships?
minecolonies.config.allowinfinitecolonie: Should players be allowed to abandon their colony to create a new one easily? Note: This is buggy!
minecolonies.config.allowotherdimcolonie: Should colonies in other dimensions be allowed?
minecolonies.config.citizenrespawninterv: If a colony is under the initial citizen count, this changes the amount of time before a new citizen spawns.
minecolonies.config.builderinfiniteresou: Should the Builder and Miner build without resources? (This also turns off what the Miner produces.)
minecolonies.config.limittoonewarehousep: Should there be a max of 1 warehouse per colony?
minecolonies.config.builderbuildblockdel: Delay after each block placement (increasing it increases the delay).
minecolonies.config.blockminingdelaymodi: Delay modifier to mine a block (decreasing it decreases the delay).
minecolonies.config.enableindevelopmentf: Should development features be enabled (might be buggy)?
Should citizen name tags be rendered?
minecolonies.config.growthmodifier.comme: Child growth modifier. On average children take about 60min to grow at 1.0x modifier (the default). 5 = 5x as fast.
minecolonies.config.workersalwaysworkinr: Should workers work during the rain?
minecolonies.config.sendenteringleavingm: Should players be sent entering/leaving colony notifications?
minecolonies.config.allowglobalnamechang: Should players be allowed to change citizen names? -1 for false, 0 for certain players only, 1 for true. (To set which players can change the names, see "Special Permissions Group" below.)
minecolonies.config.holidayfeatures.comm: Should special holiday content be displayed?
minecolonies.config.updaterate.comment: AI Update rate. Increase this to improve performance. This throttles citizen updates.
minecolonies.config.dirtfromcompost.comm: Quantity of dirt per compost filling.
minecolonies.config.luckyblockchance.com: Chance for the Miner to get an ore when mining cobblestone or stone (by default, can be expanded with datapacks to other materials). This is a percentage.
minecolonies.config.fixorphanedchunks.co: Automatically fix orphaned chunks which were caused by chunk loading and saving issues.
minecolonies.config.restrictbuilderunder: Should the Builder be slower when working underground?
minecolonies.config.fisherspongechance.c: Chance to get a sponge from the Fisher (starting at hut level 4).
minecolonies.config.fisherprismarinechan: Chance to get a prismarine shard or crystal drop from the Fisher (starting at hut level 3). Overall chance of prismarine is 2x this number.
minecolonies.config.minthleveltoteleport: The minimum level a Town Hall has to be to allow teleportation to allied colonies.
minecolonies.config.suggestbuildtoolplac: Suggest build tool usage when trying to place a building without the build tool.
minecolonies.config.canplayerusertpcomma: Can Players Use the RTP Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc rtp command?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusecolonytp: Can Players Use the Colony TP Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony teleport command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseallytown: Can players teleport to allied colonies?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusehometpco: Can Players Use the Home TP Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc home command? Note: Only owners of the colony can use this command.
minecolonies.config.canplayerusecitizeni: Can Players Use the Citizen Info Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc citizens info command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruselistciti: Can Players Use the List Citizens Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc citizens list command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseshowcolo: Can Players Use the Show Colony Info Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony info command?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusekillciti: Can Players Use the Kill Citizens Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc citizens kill command?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseaddoffic: Can Players Use the Add Officer Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony addOfficer command?
minecolonies.config.canplayerusedeleteco: Can Players Use the Delete Colony Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony delete command?
minecolonies.config.numberofattemptsfors: Number of Attempts for Safe TP
Amount of attempts to find a safe random teleport (with /mc rtp).
minecolonies.config.maxColonySize.commen: Maximum claim range for a colony. This is the radius, measured in chunks.
minecolonies.config.minColonyDistance.co: The minimum distance (in chunks) between colonies.
minecolonies.config.initialColonySize.co: Initial claim size for a colony. This is the radius, measured in chunks.
minecolonies.config.restrictcolonyplacem: Should the min/max distance from spawn also affect colony placement?
minecolonies.config.enabledynamiccolonys: Should colonies have a fixed radius or should it be dynamic?
minecolonies.config.maxdistancefromworld: Distância máxima do ponto de surgimento
Max distance (in blocks) from world spawn for a colony.
minecolonies.config.mindistancefromworld: Distância mínima do ponto de surgimento
Min distance (in blocks) from world spawn for a colony.
minecolonies.config.protectvillages.comm: Should players be allowed to build their colonies over existing (vanilla) villages?
minecolonies.config.dobarbariansspawn.co: Whether or not to spawn raiders.
minecolonies.config.spawnbarbariansize.c: The min size of a raider horde.
minecolonies.config.maxbarbariansize.com: The max size of a raider horde.
minecolonies.config.dobarbariansbreakthr: Whether or not raiders can break, scale, and bridge obstacles.
minecolonies.config.averagenumberofnight: Número médio de noites entre os ataques
The average number of nights between raids.
minecolonies.config.minimumnumberofnight: Minimum Number of Nights Between Raids
The minimum number of nights between raids.
Should citizens call Guards for help when attacked?
minecolonies.config.rangerenchants.comme: Should Archer Guards benefit from Power/Punch/Flame enchants (on bows)?
minecolonies.config.pvp_mode.comment: Turn on MineColonies PVP mode (colonies can be destroyed and griefed under certain conditions).
minecolonies.config.daysuntilpirateships: Quantidade de dias até que os navios piratas desapareçam
Days until the pirate ships despawn.
minecolonies.config.maxyforbarbarians.co: Max Y level (height) for Raiders to spawn.
minecolonies.config.turnoffexplosionsinc: Independent from the colony protection, should explosions be turned off inside colonies?
minecolonies.config.specialpergroup.comm: Players who have special permissions, especially to change citizen names (see "Name Changes" above).
minecolonies.config.freetointeractblocks: Blocks players should be able to interact with in any colony (ex: vending machines)
minecolonies.config.secondsbetweenpermis: Seconds between each permission message (to reduce spam).
minecolonies.config.dynamictreeharvestsi: Forester harvest trunk size for dynamic trees: 1-8.
minecolonies.config.minimumRailsToPath.c: Minimum number of consecutive rails for citizens to use them.
minecolonies.config.pathfindingmaxthread: Amount of additional threads to be used for pathfinding.
Max amount of nodes (positions) to map during pathfinding. Lowering increases performance, but might lead to pathing glitches.
minecolonies.config.enabledebuglogging.c: Should the request system show debug information? Useful if malfunctioning.
minecolonies.config.maximalretries.comme: The maximal amount of tries that the request system will perform for retryable requests. Higher increases server load.
The amount of ticks between retries of the request system for retryable requests. Lower increases server load.
minecolonies.config.maximalbuildingstoga: The maximal amount of buildings the Courier should try to gather from before attempting a drop off at the warehouse.
minecolonies.config.minimalbuildingstoga: The minimal amount of buildings the Courier should try to gather from before attempting a drop off at the warehouse.
minecolonies.config.creativeresolve.comm: Should the request system creatively resolve (if possible) when the player is required to resolve a request?
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseresetcom: Can Players Use the Request System Reset Command
Should players be allowed to use the /mc colony requestsystem-reset command?

com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.suppli: §6 Welcome to MineColonies. Now that you have your supplies, how about searching a nice location to place your Town Hall to create your colony...though far away from a vanilla village, if possible.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: §6 Word is out about a newly founded colony. Soon the first settlers will join your colony, if there is enough space around the Town Hall. (Experienced governors can turn off these helpful messages in the Town Hall block.)
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.first_: §6 The first settler arrived at your colony! You should place a Builder's Hut to start your settlement.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 Great job on the placement of the Builder's Hut! However, that's not enough. You need to access it and click the Build Building button! Soon your citizen will be creating new structures for the village.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.built_: §6 While your Builder is working, you can check on the resources he needs on the second page of the building GUI.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 With the Builder's Hut completed, we should turn our attention to resource production. Perhaps you should get a Forester or Miner and a Tavern to house your citizens.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.resour: §6 Producing resources costs energy and makes your settlers hungry. You might want to build a Farm, Fisher's Hut, or animal herder's hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.food_p: §6 Sua cidade começa a florescer! Para melhorar a produtividade, você precisa aprimorar os edifícios.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 Agora todos os seus pioneiros estão empregados. Para atrair mais pioneiros, você tem que construir ou aprimorar moradias para eles.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.all_ci: §6 I see all your settlers have a nice home now. Build more Houses to get more settlers!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 The last initial citizen arrived at your colony. To spawn new children, build a House and assign a male and female citizen to it.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.seven_: §6 A new settler arrived at your colony, and they bring word that barbarian spies have found the growing village. You might want to build a Guard Tower!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.six_ci: §6 A growing settlement means a growing responsibility. You should consider placing a Restaurant to keep your settlers well fed.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.eight_: §6 Your citizens urge you to build a Warehouse. This will lighten your backpack, and they may get their materials faster!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.wareho: §6 You've built a Warehouse. However, your people are too tasked as it is to fill it. Build some Courier's Huts to hire Couriers. Up to 2 can work per Warehouse level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.nine_c: §6 Settlers are saying that their skills influence their leveling speed. You can manually employ citizens, if it is turned on in the Town Hall settings. The best skills for the job will be highlighted during the employment process.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.manual: §6 Workers are complaining about a long walk to their work. You can manually assign them to the closest houses, if the option is turned on in the Town Hall settings.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.ten_ci: §6 A growing colony increases the burdens on your settlers. You should consider upgrading your work huts.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.twenty: §6 A barbarian spy had been caught next to your colony, and he seems to be from a bigger group! You should consider building Barracks to defend your colony.
§6 Your colony's population has grown to the limits of current management techniques. To accept more citizens, complete the research at the University.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.not_en: §6 Building more Houses than available jobs has a bad influence on your citizens' happiness.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.newchi: §6 A new child is now happily living in your colony!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.childg: %s cresceu e agora quer um trabalho.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.hireci: §6 Your recruitment package was accepted and a new citizen arrived!

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
O construtor(a) é a peça central da sua colônia. Sem ele(a), você não consegue fazer nada!
Todos os trabalhadores devem ter seu prédio construído até o nível 1 antes de poderem fazer qualquer coisa, exceto o construtor(a). Se o construtor(a) tiver uma cabana no nível 0 (sem cabana), ele(a) só pode construir uma coisa: a sua própria cabana.

Para que o seu construtor(a) construa, aprimore, reposicione ou conserte uma cabana que não seja a dele(a), sua cabana deve ter pelo menos o mesmo nível da outra cabana. Por exemplo, a cabana do construtor(a) deve ser de nível 3 ou superior para construir uma cabana de nível 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
Vamos abordar as restrições do construtor(a):

   1. Construtores e a maioria dos outros trabalhadores desbloqueiam certos níveis de ferramentas por nível de cabana:
     Nível 0. Ferramentas de madeira / ouro
     Nível 1. Ferramentas de pedra
     Nível 2. Ferramentas de ferro
     Nível 4. Ferramentas de diamante
     Nível 5. Ferramentas encantadas

   2. Os construtores têm um alcance máximo de 100 blocos para edifícios para atribuição automática. Se o seu edifício estiver fora desse intervalo, no canto superior direito das opções de construção GUI (para a cabana que você deseja construir), você pode selecionar qual construtor(a) que você deseja atribuir a esse edifício.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
Agora, vamos abordar algumas perguntas frequentes:

P1. Estou vendo um item na página de recursos necessários que parece inalcançável ou requer Silk Touch para ser obtido. O que devo fazer?
R1. Coisas como ar, caminhos de terra e outros blocos aparecerão na guia de recursos necessários de tempos em tempos. Enquanto eles aparecem, concentre-se principalmente no guia de solicitação pessoal do seu construtor(a). Eles geralmente solicitarão o bloco correto e o converterão de acordo (por exemplo, solicitar terra e em seguida, usar uma pá nele).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.
 At higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: The House is where your citizens will live. For every level of the House, the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a House are your Guards.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one House. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any House or Tavern within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: Workers have their level capped by the level of their House. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: O(a) Mineiro(a) é um(a) dos(as) trabalhadores da produção da sua colônia. Eles precisarão de uma picareta para extrair pedras, uma pá para extrair terra e cascalho e, às vezes, até mesmo de um machado se baterem em um poço de mina. Eles também precisarão de suprimentos para construir seus próprios poços de minas, como blocos, lajes, cercas / paredes, sinais, escadas e tochas.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Vamos abordar as restrições:

  1. Os mineiros desbloqueiam certos níveis de ferramentas por nível de cabana:
    Nível 0. Ferramentas de madeira / ouro
    Nível 1. Ferramentas de pedra
    Nível 2. Ferramentas de ferro
    Nível 4. Ferramentas de diamante
    Nível 5. Ferramentas encantadas
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Agora vamos abordar algumas perguntas frequentes:

P 1. Qual a profundidade que o(a) minerador(a) irá cavar antes de fazer nós?
R 1. Sem intervenção, no nível 1 eles construirão nós após atingirem y nível 50, no nível 2 eles farão nós após atingirem y nível 30 e no nível 3 eles farão nós após atingirem y nível 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My Miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the Miner's request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, Miners level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The Forester is one of the production workers for your colony. Give them an axe and they'll cut down any trees around them. They'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees they can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page. Here you can tell the Forester to not replant saplings and tell them to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Foresters unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Foresters are able to search for trees within 150 blocks of them (not their hut). While searching, they start with a 50 block range and then increase that range by 5 if they do not find a tree.

3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best. We've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally we define a tree as a log and leaves (near each other), due to this some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the Forester, to counter this you can place a piece of Cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".

As all workers do, Foresters level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Forester's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Warehouse is part of colony management. It's where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the Warehouse, but Couriers use the Warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic and you can not add your own. If you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the Couriers will not see/use those racks. You also cannot move the racks already in the building. If you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the Couriers.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space that is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building. If the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by buying more on page 2 of the GUI using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my Warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the Builder. If you must move the Warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any Couriers don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: Couriers are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony and will pick up unneeded items from worker huts and drop them at the Warehouse, as well as gather needed items from the Warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The number of stacks a Courier can carry at a time depends on their hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited stacks (that can still fit in their inventory)

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the Couriers pickup from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a pickup priority setting. 1 is the lowest, 10 is the highest, and there's also never (no items will ever be picked up).

 Q 2. Can I change the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by order the request is sent.

As all workers do, Couriers level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Courier's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.0:
The Cook is part of the food production of your colony. The Cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes, as well as other cooked food that only needs a furnace.
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the Cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The Cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-cooked items for the Cook to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
As all workers do, the Cook levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cook's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.0: The Baker is part of the food production of your colony. They will bake bread, cookies, pumpkin pie, and/or cake. On page two of the Bakery GUI, you can select which items you want them to make.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.1: The Baker cannot make any food with items that are not consumed in the making like pots and pans. These are usually from mods like Pam's.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Baker is using more items than they are producing, why?
   A 1. The Baker may be consuming some product when they get hungry. Also, while the wheat/other ingredients may not be visible, the product may still be in the process of being produced.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.3:
As all workers do, the Baker levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Baker's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Farmer grows crops for the colony. The Farmer can plant and harvest any crop that is planted in farmland, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers cannot grow plants that do not use farm land, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. These are grown by the Planter instead.
 Farmers can only maintain one field per their hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I want a smaller field, how do I tell my Farmer not to grow crops up to the maximum size? 
   A 1. Use the Field GUI to set the size of the field.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.3:
As all workers do, the Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Fisher is part of the food production of your colony. Simply put, the Fisher will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing rod and a big enough area of water.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The Fisher needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at the same level as the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Fisher is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The Fishermen can catch other items, same as a player can.

As all workers do, the Fisher levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Fisher's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The Chicken Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Chicken Farmer breeds, raises, and butchers chickens. They will collect eggs, feathers, and meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Chicken Farmer will keep two chickens alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chicken Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided for the Chicken Farmer to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Chicken Farmer need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The Chicken Farmer also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Chicken Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Chicken Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.swineherde: The Swineherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Swineherd breeds, raises, and butchers pigs. They will collect the meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Swineherd will keep two pigs alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two pigs must be provided for the Swineherd to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

   A 1. You need to supply at least two pigs to get things started. The Swineherd also needs carrots to breed the pigs and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Swineherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Swineherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.0: The Shepherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Shepherd breeds, raises, shears, and butchers sheep. They will collect the meat and wool, as well as any drops from other mods. The Shepherd will keep two sheep alive per level of their hut. If you choose, on the second page of the GUI you can tell the Shepherd to randomly dye sheep to get colored wool.

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.0: The Cowhand is part of the food production of your colony. The Cowhand breeds, raises, and butchers cows. They will collect the meat and leather, as well as any drops from other mods. The Cowhand will keep two cows alive per level of their hut.

The Composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The Composter will turn items into compost for Farmers and Florists to use.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the Composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the hut GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts!

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, but these must be added in the MineColonies configuration file. This is found in (your instance folder)/config/minecolonies-common.toml.

As all workers do, the Composter levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Composter's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower:
The Guard Tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each Guard Tower employs one Guard. However, the Guard will also live in the tower, freeing up a bed for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Guard Tower was leveled up, but the Guard isn't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guard levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracksto:
The Barracks Tower is the heart of your military defense. Each Barracks Tower employs 1 Guard per level for a total of 5. However, the Guards will also live in the tower, freeing up beds for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Barracks Tower was leveled up, but the Guards aren't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guards level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The Barracks is the heart of your military defense. Without it you wouldn't be able to build any Barracks Towers!
 Each Barracks contains four Barracks Towers, one for each level (up to level four).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 Barracks Tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the Barracks. So if you have a level 1 Barracks, it will only allow 1 Barracks Tower with a max level of 1. If you have a level 3 Barracks, it will allow 3 Barracks Towers with a max level of 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than 1 Barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the Barracks Tower levels are based on the Barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one Barracks that is level 5, if the second Barracks is only level 1, then that Barracks can only have a single level 1 tower.
